Name: postscriptum
Overview: This Docker will download and install SteamCMD. It will also install PostScriptum and run it.

game_id.Name: GAME_ID
game_id.Description:
The GAME_ID that the container download at startup.
(https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Dedicated_Servers_List)

game_params.Name: GAME_PARAMS
game_params.Description: Enter your start up commands for the server (for example the server admin: --admin [YOURsteamID64] e.g: '--admin 123456789123456789' without quotes).

steam-username.Name: Steam-Username
steam-username.Description: Your Steam username goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

validateinstallation.Name: Validate Installation
validateinstallation.Description: Set the Variable to 'true' if you want to validate the installation otherwise leave it blank.

steam-password.Name: Steam-Password
steam-password.Description: Your Steam password goes here if you want to install a game that needs a valid account, otherwise leave it blank (ATTENTION: You have to disable Steam Guard).

udp1-gameport.Name: UDP1 - GamePort
udp1-gameport.Description: UDP GamePort (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the port number in the 'GAME_PARAMS')

udp2-queryport.Name: UDP2 - QueryPort
udp2-queryport.Description: UDP QueryPort (if you need another port, please delete this entry and create a new UDP Port with the required port number, also don't forget to change the port number in the 'GAME_PARAMS')
